bibl.title: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, October 2, 1899

div1.p: Reed details his activities for the month of September 1899. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, October 2, 1899
div1.opener:
All communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
U. S. Army Medical Museum and Library,
Corner 7th and B Streets SW.,
Washington, October 2, 1899.
TO THE ADJUTANT GENERAL,
U. S. Army.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to report that from September 1 to September
28, 1899, I have been on duty in the Surgeon General's Office, as
Curator of the Army Medical Museum, in accordance with Par. 2, S.O.
No. 153, dated Headquarters of the Army, Adjutant General's Office,
Washington, D.C., July 7, 1893, and from September 28 to September
30, 1899, at Fort Thomas, Ky., on official business pertaining to
the Medical Department, under order from the Secretary of War, dated
September 26, 1899.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Walter Reed, Major & Surgeon, U.S.A.
Curator.
